data.title: British experts say they have found London's lost Black Death graves: Archaeologists in Britain have solved a 660-year-old mystery, citing DNA tests which they said proved they had found a lost burial site for tens of thousands of people killed in medieval London by the "Black Death" plague.
At least 100,000 people take to the streets of Taiwan's capital Taipei, to protest controversial China trade agreement
Israeli bulldozers destroy Palestinian owned mosque and medical center in East Jerusalem
Turkey started hijacking IP addresses for popular Global DNS providers

Black Death Was Not Spread by Rat Fleas - Evidence from skulls in London shows plague had to have been airborne to spread so fast & kill so quickly, making it a pneumonic plague rather than a bubonic one.
Iran names member of militant group that held 52 Americans hostage in Tehran in 1979 to be its UN ambassador
Brunei brings in system of Islamic law with punishments that include the dismemberment of limbs and stoning to death
Vladimir Putin 'Wants to Regain Finland' Says Close Adviser
Silk Road closure fails to dampen illegal drug sales online, experts say
